## MATHEMATICS

9709/12  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 303, 310, 319]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Pure Mathematics 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[784, 303, 910, 320]]<|/det|>
May/June 2022  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 910, 345]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 357, 395, 373]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 875, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 664, 216, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
The coefficient of \(x^{4}\) in the expansion of \((3 + x)^{5}\) is equal to the coefficient of \(x^{2}\) in the expansion of \(\left(2x + \frac{a}{x}\right)^{6}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 135, 445, 154]]<|/det|>
Find the value of the positive constant \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 135, 920, 154]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 761, 92]]<|/det|>
The second and third terms of a geometric progression are 10 and 8 respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 104, 314, 123]]<|/det|>
Find the sum to infinity.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 78, 94, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is such that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = 3(4x - 7)^{\frac{1}{2}} - 4x^{-\frac{1}{2}}\). It is given that the curve passes through the point \(\left(4, \frac{5}{2}\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 134, 364, 153]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 134, 920, 153]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 863, 92]]<|/det|>
The first, second and third terms of an arithmetic progression are \(k\), \(6k\) and \(k + 6\) respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 104, 146, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 104, 415, 123]]<|/det|>
Find the value of the constant \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 475, 186, 494]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 475, 579, 494]]<|/det|>
Find the sum of the first 30 terms of the progression.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 475, 920, 494]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[303, 87, 715, 298]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 317, 831, 338]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y = 5x^{\frac{1}{2}}\) and the line with equation \(y = 2x + 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 349, 787, 368]]<|/det|>
Find the exact area of the shaded region which is bounded by the line and the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 350, 920, 368]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
Hence find the area of the shaded region \(BPC\) giving your answer correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 88, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the tangent to the circle at the point \(A\), giving your answer in the form \(px + qy = k\), where \(p\), \(q\) and \(k\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 77, 92, 95]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 606, 98]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(y = 3x + 1 - 4(3x + 1)^{\frac{1}{2}}\) for \(x > -\frac{1}{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 116, 146, 136]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 112, 304, 141]]<|/det|>
Find \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}}\) and \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^2\mathrm{y}}{\mathrm{dx}^2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 803, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of the stationary point of the curve and determine its nature.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 75, 443, 92]]<|/det|>
Functions f and g are defined as follows:

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[395, 100, 603, 133]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{f}(x) = \frac{2x + 1}{2x - 1}\quad \mathrm{for} x\neq \frac{1}{2},\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 136, 594, 156]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{g}(x) = x^{2} + 4\quad \mathrm{for} x\in \mathbb{R}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 180, 146, 198]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[242, 185, 819, 450]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 464, 546, 483]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 495, 351, 514]]<|/det|>
State the domain of \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 497, 920, 515]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 611, 148, 628]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 610, 400, 628]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 610, 920, 628]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 821, 143, 840]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 821, 268, 840]]<|/det|>
Find \(\mathrm{gf}^{-1}(3)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 821, 920, 840]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 455, 92]]<|/det|>
Explain why \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}(x)\) cannot be found.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 918, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 191, 144, 210]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 186, 920, 231]]<|/det|>
Show that \(1 + \frac{2}{2x - 1}\) can be expressed as \(\frac{2x + 1}{2x - 1}\). Hence find the area of the triangle enclosed by the tangent to the curve \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\) at the point where \(x = 1\) and the \(x\)- and \(y\)-axes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 212, 918, 231]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 833, 92]]<|/det|>
The function f is given by \(\operatorname {f}(x) = 4\cos^4 x + \cos^2 x - k\) for \(0\leqslant x\leqslant 2\pi\), where \(k\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 104, 146, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 103, 680, 122]]<|/det|>
Given that \(k = 3\), find the exact solutions of the equation \(\operatorname {f}(x) = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 103, 920, 122]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]
